definition[0]: when you completely own a building or piece of land for an unlimited time
example[0]: They bought the freehold of their house.
definition[1]: complete ownership of a building or land for an unlimited time
example[1]: Residential leaseholders living in blocks of flats have the right to acquire the freehold of their block at the market rate.
example[2]: He was forced to sell the freehold of his estate.
example[3]: The cost of freehold land is so high that only a wealthy man who farms intensively can hope to make a living on his own farm.
example[4]: The increase in fixed assets reflects two major freehold property purchases.
